oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The antibiotic used first in beef cattle with respiratory disease (attributable to Pasteurella haemolytica) was erythromycin. The cure rate fell from 60% in 1984 to 53% in 1985. Cases which failed to respond were next treated with amoxicillin, giving combined cure rates of 82% in 1984 and 87.5% in 1985. Spectinomycin was the third antibiotic used, if needed. The sensitivity of P. haemolytica to these antibiotics was discussed.
